text:
I have a directory name on Windows with spaces, a '&' character, a '%'
character, and a ',' character in the name (don't ask, I didn't create it).

The entry in the changelog xml file looks like:

<entry>
  <date>2005-05-03</date>
  <time>15:33</time>
  <author><![CDATA[username]]></author>
  <file>
    <name>foo/bar/37400 Al-7075/37451 7079-T7 & T76 100 % HUMIDITY,
RT/37451.txt</name>
    <revision>1.3</revision>
    <prevrevision>1.2</prevrevision>
  </file>
 

The XSL stylesheet processor complains about the '&' character. There should
probably be appropriate character escaping somewhere.
creator: bgn6bc802@sneakemail.com
phil.weighill-smith@volantis.com
text:
The XML Change log is not in valid XML form; the XML file should look like:

  <file>
    <name>foo/bar/37400 Al-7075/37451 7079-T7 & T76 100 % HUMIDITY,
RT/37451.txt</name>
    <revision>1.3</revision>
    <prevrevision>1.2</prevrevision>
  </file>

(If there is a schema for this file that defines the <file> <name> content as 
an "any URI" type then additional encoding would be required to make that 
valid).

Whatever application is generating this file is not creating it correctly; the 
error is not with the style task.

This bug should probably have an "INVALID" or "WONTFIX" resolution.

creator: bgn6bc802@sneakemail.com
text: The Ant cvschangelog task created this XML file.
